sense.name: a building shingle
sense.examples: These are better quality shakes that are good for roofing. The Queen Anne victorian house had scalloped shakes covering the turret.

sense.name: a dairy_based, cold blended drink
sense.examples: We ordered two chocolate shakes, two burgers and two fries. Mary asked for her shake to be made with soy milk.

sense.name: a musical vocalization that is a trill
sense.examples: This baroque song requires ornamentation with shakes. The critics disliked the countertenor's shakes, but liked his perfect high C.

sense.name: grasping hands in greeting or agreement
sense.examples: The deal was finalized with the shake of their hands. The big man gave her hand a crushing shake as he said hello.

sense.name: physiological trembling, shivering
sense.examples: The alcoholic gets a bad case of the shakes without a drink. The dog's shake is because of the thunder and lightening. The man held the pen in his hand with a noticeable shake.

sense.name: sideways motion
sense.examples: WIth a shake of its horns, the bull charged the matador. Camera shake will cause the image to be blurred. With a shake of the dice, Pete rolled double sixes.

sense.name: earthquake, temblor
sense.examples: The city is not prepared for a really big shake. The last shake put a crack in the kitchen ceiling. The shakes yesterday were the aftershocks of the big earthquake two days ago.

sense.name: a small approximate amount
sense.examples: The recipe calls for a few shakes of paprika on the top of the casserole. John's secret recipe for mojitos includes a shake of black pepper.

sense.name: fair chance, fair treatment
sense.examples: The reporter did not give the candidate a fair shake during the interview. Mary believes she was given a fair shake at her job interviews.

sense.name: not impressive or distinguished
sense.examples: The film is no great shakes as an artistic endeavor. The houses we looked at were no great shakes.
